title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was decent, with many relevant questions asked, and responses given when you questioned in return.  Depending on interview, you may or may not interview with the Principal Investigator, which I found slightly insulting as they are the one hiring, not their staff.
Interview Questions: Have you ever done any bioinformatics before?

title: CRA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted in a week after applying, process was very fast and straightforward, but background process is done by a third party who took some extra time. I had to meet with every team on the particular project one by one in different days as most of them were not available on the same day
Interview Questions: They believed I was over-qualified for the position, asked me what my rationale is for taking a low step

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the group leader sending an email and resume. We had a telephone conversation. He requested 4 letters of recommendations. After a couple of weeks he asked me to visit the lab and give a 1-hour presentation in front of the rest of the department. After another two weeks he contacted me tell me I've been hired. My job started 9 moths later (but it could be sooner if I hadn't an agreement with the previous job).
Interview Questions: what are you going to bring to the group?

title: Associate Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: This research faculty position was suggested by my adviser after two years as a postdoc in his lab. There was no official job posting and interview for this position and the hiring turned out to be just a smooth internal position transition.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: Once you get an interview it's fairly simple. You will be interviewing with another 40 students so just make sure not too stand out negatively. Prepare for meeting with individual Professors by knowing about their research and be able to talk about your own research and experiences.
Interview Questions: One related to my own research and the applicability in a clinical setting.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: chat with the prof and see if you have related background before. profs usually be nice to you and you don't have to worry that much if your answer is not perfect. They are flexible people in the universities.
Interview Questions: why you are interested in this job and what you could bring to this job

title: Kitchen Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Simple meeting with the manager of the center and tour of the building followed by some questions in his office about my history, work experience, why I wanted the job
Interview Questions: What do you consider your strength

title: Communications Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Whole process took about 3 months. Very thorough. Very nice people. Had an initial HR phone screening, then a one-on-one with the HR director in person, then a one-on-one with the hiring manager, then a group interview with the whole department. It was a lot of interviewing.
Interview Questions: How do you feel you can contribute to the department?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Yale University in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I received a telephone interview 2 months after submitting my application, and was invited for an on campus interview 2 months after that. I was offered the position 1 month later.

The telephone interview was pretty straightforward: a series of about 15 questions, mostly pertaining to my previous experience. 

The on campus interview included 
-a dinner the night before
-3 individual interviews (hiring manager, another director and the dean) 
-a groups interview with the office staff
-a presentation for 15 people including faculty, staff and researchers
-followed by a discussion period with the audience.
Interview Questions: There were no very difficult or unexpected questions. Mostly they wanted to hear how I would implement a new series of programs.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Appointment with 3 different Principal Investigators in the same field. The appointment were dispatched in two days total.
Around 1h each during which you talk about your past research/contributions/motivations. And a little bit informal question at the end.
Interview Questions: What did you do during your PhD?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: overall it was a good interview, the manager was very nice and did not ask anything difficult. The interview lasted about 20 min. I also met with a few library staff and librarians and had a tour of the library. Everyone was very nice and said they enjoyed working here.
Interview Questions: do you prefer cooking at home, or go skiing?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I gave a presentation to the group for my research projects in Brown Univ and Scripps.  Supervisor was happy about my performance and productivity.  I had lunch and dinner with the group and get all the travel and related cost covered.
Interview Questions: What is the most critical factor for a postdoc research

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: Graduate students in my field are not interviewed prior to being accepted, but each field is different.
Interview Questions: Important aspects of grad school application are letters of recommendation, as well as one's personal statement, which must be aligned with at least some of the research being done at the university.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Waited forever after applying to several posted online positions. No acknowledgement from HR ever if even received. Finally after two months or more, get an email stating one of the positions had been cancelled. Joke. They already have jobs so they could care less if youre left in the street.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was highly technical but brief. We talked about the research that they were conducting at Yale, we talked about my goals, the interviewer asked me why I applied and what made me think that this would be a good step for my career.
Interview Questions: Regarding my research. Why I want to join them. What are my goals.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New York, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
good and easy to tackle,
If your application has been selected for an interview, a member of the department’s hiring team will contact you to set up a time. (If you don’t live in Yukon, initial interviews may be conducted by phone or Internet video.) Now, this is your chance to do some background research
Interview Questions: why do u apply for this job

title: Software Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Yale uses Brass Ring for entering formal applications for staff jobs.  The application is painstaking; none the information on an attached resume or other job site is automatically captured. In addition to the on-line application, networking is almost always necessary to get an interview.    In IT, staff jobs are rapidly being replaced by contract workers.  The interview process is very similar; count on many candidates and individual interviews with several stakeholders.
Interview Questions:
How to you manage conflict in day to day work situations?
What awards have you won recently from another employer?
Describe a situation where you had responsibility to make quick decisions.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: First is phone interview. Some basic questions about research projects done before, why choose the new lab, any visa sponsorship needs. Then on-site interview to give a presentation, then meet with other postdoc working there.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Recording Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: My interview was at the studio with three current student staff members. It lasted for about 20 minutes. I heard back after three days. Found the opportunity on university's careers website. The three interviewers were all very nice. No tricky questions - just try to demonstrate interest and dedication.
Interview Questions: How flexible is your schedule?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: Send CV first, got invited for onsite interview. The interview process took one day, including  1 hour presentation and 7-8 people one-to-one interview
Interview Questions: what do you plan to do if you join in the lab?

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: My pi is great. Just the lab environment is not fit for me
Interview Questions: Deal with people

title: Web Content Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was culled from interview process the same day.
Interview Questions: No questions asked.

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Asked me about prior experience and interest. No hard questions, very eager to hire. Some behavioral and hypothetical questions regarding possible scenarios I might encoutner and how I'd react. Very casual, not stressful at all.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer came to you and said X is broken?

title: MD/MPH Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: Very tight-knit community. Committed to supporting students and applicants.
Interview Questions: Statement of purpose.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I initially contacted the PI about potential research in his group. Then we had some email exchanges about research projects. The we met in-person to discuss more about the future research projects. Offer was given shortly after. Post-offer processes went very smoothly.
Interview Questions: Describe your research plan. The PI provided inputs and eventually we found something that are of interest to both of us.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of a full day of in depth scientific discussion with the hiring professor and a full 1 hour talk, including meetings with other laboratory members.  I was tested on my scientific knowledge and creativity, and potential work projects were defined.  The presentation is key to getting an offer, but scientists usually know you ahead of time.  I had met the hiring professor at meetings and so we were already acquainted.  They took me out to dinner at a nice restaurant in New Haven.
Interview Questions: What projects are you interested in doing and where do you see your future research?

title: Development Associate, Prospect Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions:
There was a significant lag-time between submitting my application online and being contacted. After that, however, things moved fairly swiftly: a skills test, a chat on the phone, a Skype interview. The staff was incredibly kind, handled some technical snafus with grace, and were strangely interested in my background (which was completely unrelated to the position – frankly, I hadn't expected to be contacted at all). Overall, they seemed like a great team for which to work.

After the last interview, they said they would get back to me in a couple of weeks or so; at that point, our brief run of incredibly consistent, frequent communication essentially fell flat. I only found out that I had not been selected when I happened to notice my status on the HR website. That being said, it remains one of the more enjoyable interview processes I've gone through.
Interview Questions: How do you handle distractions?

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was an initial phone screen, and then a in-person behavioral interviews with HR and the managers of the group hiring you. The managers asked me about my experience, and a few light technical questions, and that was pretty much it. Much to my surprise, there was no whiteboard coding, no problem solving, nothing.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about working with people?

title: Development Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT)
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview with a senior associate in the dept led to interviews with Principal Gifts Officer, Principal Gifts Director, and other Development Associates. Then completed a directed writing sample.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict of interest you have encountered in your work and how you handled it.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Following the submission of applicaiton, i was contacted by the professor who was interested to hire me. We then had a phone/skype interview following which the professor offered the position by email correspondence after a couple of weeks.
Interview Questions: 1. area of research and how comfortable was I in the area of research that i will be working on.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone/Skype interview that lasted about 30 minutes. Asked questions about research interest and what you want to accomplish during the postdoc period. One has to have well defined goals to accomplish anything.
Interview Questions:
Research focus
What you want to accomplish
Send a writing sample

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: Very informal.
Interview Questions: How to prioritize tasks

title: Post Doctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University
Interview Descriptions: applied online, followed by phone interview and visited the department for presentation of research work,
Interview Questions: None

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Yale University (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very brief questions on what you want to be, plans for the future, and technical questions regarding laboratory experience(if any).  The atmosphere is very casual, and informative at the same time.  If you get an interview you're pretty much hired.  So if you live in the area and looking to make some temporary money while you find a real job, this is the position.
Interview Questions:
What do you plan to be in the future?
What do you know about working in a laboratory setting?
Describe how your college courses prepared you to work here.

title: Ph D Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New York, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got a Skype interview from my future advisor. He asked me about my skills and research. He also asked about my interests on research and talked with me about the research I was going to do at Yale.
Interview Questions: Describe in details on one of my research experiences.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I had worked previously with the Professor during my studies at Yale and so the process began with a clear description of my tasks during the research project and discussed my ideas for the research project. She was not interviewing anyone else for the position because she had decided to hire me for it. Overall, it went very well!
Interview Questions: She asked if the research project was something that I was interested in?

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through school's employment opportunities website. Called in for interview - was asked straightforward behavioral questions - and a week or so later was told I got the job.
Interview Questions: What's one challenge you faced?

title: CCE Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Application, followed by short 15 minute interview
Interview Questions: How would you confront people who want to have a party?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Online application followed by initial contact with PI and a 45 min interview with PI and another professor.
Interview Questions: Have you looked into previous work done on these lines?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: After contacting the Professor, all it took was a submission of my resume, and transcript. I was hired within a few weeks.
Interview Questions: None, everything was pretty standard. Yale really tries to get it's undergrads to do lab research - even for pay!

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview was conducted by a group of senior leaders in the area, along with prospective peers.  A follow up interview was conducted by the senior manager of the team.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenging project that you were involved in and describe how you overcame the challenged

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Yale University in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: I first had a phone interview. My PI briefly discussed the position. I then flew into NH and gave a talk 2 weeks later. I met everyone in the lab.
Interview Questions: Specifics of my previous training and what I could bring to the lab.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: A thorough scientific interview involving a seminar talk with discussion. Separate interviews with the group's PI and other faculty members from the department, as well as other scientific staff over the course of three days. It was helpful for me to have had the opportunity to discuss science with all potential future colleagues beforehand.
Interview Questions: How will your research proposal fit into our group?

title: I T Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: You basically goto the www.yale.edu website and click on "working at yale".  You create an account within their system and submit your current resume. Once that is done you can search their current available jobs database. Once you find a job that you are qualified for, you can apply for the job.
Interview Questions: I.T. technical questions and would you handle certain I.T. situations.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Shortly after submitting my resume, I got a reply back confirming that the resume had been passed along. I then received an email requesting an interview a couple of days afterward. I was interviewed by a couple of people and I had the impression that it went pretty well overall. They were being positive and encouraging, but extremely vague on the timeline and I didn't hear from them for over five weeks, other than a brief non-informative reply back to my inquiry after three weeks. Later when I checked, they'd reposted the position with a totally different job description. I get that this happens, but they could have done a much better job of not leading candidates on and keeping them in unnecessary suspense.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a difficult challenge you faced at work that you overcame.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: how to calculate the sample size? how to handle the missing data? how to build regression models...
Interview Questions: how to handle the missing data

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was quick and easy because the lab was in immediate need of assistants and the job qualifications were minimal.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Doctoral Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: App submitted online with fee. No interview was required then, but rules have changed. Applied in November, notified of acceptance in late January or February, brought in for recruiting event in March. Interview was more recruiting, as offer had been received.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, IN) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions:
first mails about interest and skills;
and then onsite fr a more detailed technical and experience test.
incuding a presentation of previous work. and answered related questions
get feedback in two weeks
get offer in two weeks
Interview Questions: give a lecture and write a short proposal

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: There were no interviews held for this position.  The selections committee selected postdoctoral associates based solely on the materials submitted as part of the on-line application.  There was not even a phone or Skype interview stage for this position (at least in the department in which I was a post- doctoral associate, which was surprising, but nice.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Whole day interview after a phone interview. Presented my graduate work and answered questions. Met with lab people to discuss the projects and the lab work culture. Met with administrative staff to discuss the immigration procedures and background checks. Had a 2 hour interview with PI about past experience and future goals apart from the project details.
Interview Questions: Scientific background

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with two professor from Yale talking about own research.
Interview Questions: What is your research interest?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: It is a regular interview for postdocs.  The professor came to meet me at the hotel, we had breakfast together, then we went to the lab to meet the rest.  I first give a presentation of my previous research, which didn't go great.  Then I talk to everyone in the lab, each for 30 minutes.  The last one to talk is the professor.  We then went to dinner and the whole thing finishes at 8:00.
Interview Questions: what is your career goal

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with professor than the lead student. Very nice academia, people.
Interview Questions: Describe a difficult past experience and how you dealt with it?

title: Senior IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Yale University in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: Getting into Yale was very difficult.  Most of it had to do with the computer system they used for HR which would scan your resume for keywords and then kick you out if it didnt match up.  So often you would get bounced from the system without human eyes even seeing your submitted resume.
Interview Questions: There were not really any difficult questions in this interview.  It was a pretty standard review of past experience.  I think what really helped was the fact that I got in there and did some temporary work as an IT consultant and that opened the door for me.

title: Postdoctoral Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: First I spoke on Skype and told what I can and what I want. Then I came to the lab to give a talk. On the seminar with the whole group  PI asked a lot of questions on the subject. It was planned to meet several group members individually so they spoke about their research. In the end it was private conversation with PI and he offered a job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Feb 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was a postdoc for several years prior to being promoted to Associate Research Scientist
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions were asked. I came prepared for the interview.

title: Senior Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Dec 2008
Interview Descriptions: Submitted online application, called in for a screening interview in HR. Offered a position different from the one I applied to, at a higher level based on HR interview. Yale can be slow to fill jobs, they don't have the same pressures as a private employer. It is common to not hear anything for a month or more and then be called for an interview. Very strict on requirements, especially education and years of experience.
Interview Questions: They focus on demonstrated accomplishments, so you will be asked to provide examples.

title: Associate Director of Community Research Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: Great process with the physician who was hiring me.  I met with him at his home and spent a few hours being interviewed and being able to ask him questions as well.
Interview Questions: The Human Resources Department was very difficult to work with and it took 5 months to become a full time employee from a contact employee.  They always asked how I was qualified for such a high level salary.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Yale University (New Haven, CT) in Jun 2008
Interview Descriptions: After interviewing with the human resource director at the School of management i was set up to interview for several positions within the school of management each time interviewing with multiple professors who i would be working with.  Overall a good experience felt that some of the professors were not interested because they thought that I would not stay in the position very long
Interview Questions: What was the last book that you read?
